Deficiency Narrative: Caregivers failed to ensure that the supervision level in a child's service plan was followed.
Correction Narrative: The administrator reports via email that the service plans will be reviewed on a quarterly basis during the child's service plan review meeting.  Monthly staff meetings will be conducted to ensure that all caregivers are aware of any supervision changes.

Deficiency Narrative: One out of three employee files reviewed did not take their required CPR/First Aid training within 90 days of their hire date.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation which included a copy of the training certificate for an employee to indicate the missing training had been completed.

Deficiency Narrative: Multiple youth reported they were forced to hold a physical position while in timeout as a form of discipline.
Correction Narrative:
On 7/25/25 an unannounced inspection (#4067611) was conducted. Interviews were conducted with multiple staff and children in care no concerns were noted. 

CORRECTIVE ACTION PLAN: 
The particular staff member named, and all other caregiver staff members will attend a refresher course on "Appropriate Discipline" by July 31, 2025. All staff will pass a post-test to ensure they have knowledge of allowable and prohibited discipline techniques.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care developed several medical conditions while in care.
Correction Narrative: Corrected by victim being observed. Administrator also indicated they ensured youth went to doctor and obtained medical treatment after the discovery.

Deficiency Narrative: One of three staff records reviewed employment affidavit was not notorized.
Correction Narrative: Corrected by affidavit for employee observed to be notarized.

Deficiency Narrative: One out of three employee files reviewed contained an outdated CPR training verification to suggest the training has not been renewed timely.
Correction Narrative:
An email was received on February 3, 2025 from the employee who has an outdated CPR/First aid training renewal which included a receipt of payment for the renewal class scheduled to be taken on February 19, 2025.
An email was received which included verification the employee's CPR renewal training had been completed on Feb. 10, 2025.

Deficiency Narrative: This standard was found deficient as part of a DFPS Investigation.
Correction Narrative: Corrected by employee no longer working at the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member put their hand around a child's neck as a means to get the child to comply, obstructing the child's breathing and resulting in injury.
Correction Narrative: Corrected by a corrective action  plan being provided regarding the operation's plan in regard to this citation moving forward.

Deficiency Narrative: The child's service plan is not being followed pertaining to supervision.
Correction Narrative: Corrected by a corrective action  plan being provided regarding the operation's plan in regard to this citation moving forward.

Deficiency Narrative: One out of three employee files reviewed contained an outdated CPR training verification to suggest the training has not been renewed timely.
Agency has not reported the EBI data for third quarter of 2024 as of assessment date.
Correction Narrative: A review of the operation's annual EBI data report was reviewed and observed to be up to date.

Deficiency Narrative: Medication which expired July 2024 was not discarded on or before expiration date.
Correction Narrative: Corrected by medication and expiration dates being observed to be compliant.

Deficiency Narrative: Agency has not reported the EBI data for third quarter of 2024 as of inspection date.
There was no documentation that child's rights were explained to child within 7 days of placement in two of the children records.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation which included a corrective action plan indicating intake personnel will ensure child's rights are reviewed with new youth placed at the operation. It also indicated a monthly audit of all resident records will be completed to ensure they're in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed that fire inspection expired on 11/01/24.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation which included a corrective action plan indicating the operation will maintain a spreadsheet to keep track of all inspection due dates and will review it monthly to ensure due dates are not missed. A receipt of payment for the annual fire inspection was also provided.

Deficiency Narrative: Review of two staff records revealed that the caregivers did not receive the required 4 hours of EBI training every 6 months.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation which included a corrective action plan indicating all employees are up to date on their EBI training. It also indicated the compliance manager has created a spreadsheet to keep track of all employees' trainings and will review it monthly with each employee to ensure they are completing trainings timely. The training certificates verifying completion was also provided for the employees missing it.

Deficiency Narrative: Review of one child record found youth did not participate in the service plan meeting, and there was no documentation of justification for no participation.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation which included a corrective action plan indicating the Treatment Director will be responsible for ensuring the youth participate in their service plan meetings and document a reason on the service plan if the youth is unable to attend.

Deficiency Narrative: Per conversation with the administrator, the agency does not maintain financial records for 2023 that comply with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation which included a corrective action plan indicating management personnel will obtain a copy of the operation's financial statements from their Certified Public Accountant quarterly to maintain at the operation for Licensing to review upon request.

Deficiency Narrative: Review of 2 children records found PLSP did not date the prliminary service plan; initial service plan; and/or service plan review.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the operation which included a corrective action plan indicating the newly hired Program Director will be responsible for ensuring all relevant treatment team members sign the youth's service plans accordingly.

Deficiency Narrative: Observed during walkthrough a camera in children bedroom.
A volunteer to the operation does not have a background check completed by the operation.
Correction Narrative: Corrected.

Deficiency Narrative: This standard was found deficient as part of a DFPS Investigation.
Correction Narrative:
An email was received on 8/13/24 from the operation's administrator. The email included a letter written to send to all legal parents of the current youth in care. In the letter it was indicated the employee involved was terminated, the operation has updated their training curriculum, and they have increased management oversight of the operation to ensure the nature of the incident doesn't occur again.

On 8/15/24, current youth in care at the operation were interviewed and determined the reason for the deficiency is no longer occurring.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was slapped by a caregiver in the face which caused a bruise.
Correction Narrative:
An email was received on 8/13/24 from the operation's administrator. The email included a letter written to send to all legal parents of the current youth in care. In the letter it was indicated the employee involved was terminated, the operation has updated their training curriculum, and they have increased management oversight of the operation to ensure the nature of the incident doesn't occur again.

On 8/15/24, current youth in care at the operation were interviewed and determined the reason for the deficiency is no longer occurring.

Deficiency Narrative: A serious incident report requested from the operation was not provided for an investigation.
Correction Narrative: During the exit interview with the administrator via a phone call, the administrator stated she will be responsible for following up with their designee to ensure all requested documentation is provided.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the bathrooms does not have sufficient water pressure.
Correction Narrative: The facility sent the following corrections by email:Turning Point will ensure that during the daily Facility walkthrough, water pressure throughout the house will be checked.  Any issues with water pressure will be written up and given to maintenance for repair.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found that a staff was not inactivated that is no longer working at the facility.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent in the following corrections by email:Turning Point will ensure that staff not associated with Facility are removed from Background checks 7 days after their last day of employment.  This task will be reviewed by Compliance and followed up by Administrator the last of employment, to ensure the background check has been removed from the system.

Deficiency Narrative: The operations Recreational Calendar does not contain daily indoor and outdoor activities.
Correction Narrative: The operation sent the following by email:Turning Point will ensure that the Recreational Calendar contains daily indoor and outdoor activities.  PLSP has added task to Calendar, and it will be discussed in daily staffing to ensure that Calendar is completed prior to the month due. The operation also sent in an corrected calendar

Deficiency Narrative: One bedroom occupied by a youth in care does not have a window.
Correction Narrative: A team inspection of the home and outside physical site was completed at the facility by Licensing Inspectors, Carla McGowen, Carolyn Washington and Veronica Martinez. There were no children occupying the upstairs bedroom.

Deficiency Narrative: Investigator reported several unsuccessful attempts to make contact with Administrator.
Correction Narrative: Turning Point Childrens Social Service will ensure that Administrators is always available to speak with Licensing staff.  Administrator will be responsible for this task.

Deficiency Narrative: During the monitoring inspection: The name on the staff list was incorrect. The contract staff binder contained information from another operation other than Turning Point.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, there was a missing face plate/cover, which was located at the bottom of the kitchen freezer. There was a small opening with minor wiring exposed.
Correction Narrative: Turning Point sent a photo showing the exposed wiring had been covered on the back of the refrigerator as a correction.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation admitted a child with Autism Spectrum disorder and are not licensed to provide the treatment services to meet the child's needs.
Correction Narrative: Administrator will be responsible for ensuring that Turning Point Childrens Social Service is able to meet the needs of children admitted, and licensed.
